Data Structures | Macros | Enumerations | Functions | Variables
SYSPLL - System PLL
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides comprehensive functions for interfacing with the System PLL (Phase-Locked Loop) on Apollo5 devices. It supports PLL configuration, frequency generation, lock management, and clock multiplexing for precise clock generation and distribution.

Key Features

  1. PLL Configuration: Flexible PLL parameter configuration.
  2. Frequency Generation: Precise frequency generation and control.
  3. Lock Management: PLL lock detection and wait functionality.
  4. Clock Multiplexing: Support for multiple clock source selection.
  5. Bypass Mode: PLL bypass functionality for direct clock routing.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure System PLL
  • Generate precise clock frequencies
  • Handle PLL lock detection and management
  • Support clock multiplexing and selection
  • Enable/disable PLL and bypass modes

Usage

  1. Initialize PLL using am_hal_syspll_initialize()
  2. Configure PLL parameters and frequencies
  3. Enable PLL and wait for lock
  4. Configure clock multiplexing as needed
  5. Disable PLL when no longer needed

Configuration

  • PLL Parameters: Configure reference and feedback dividers
  • Frequency Settings: Set up output frequencies and VCO ranges
  • Lock Timing: Configure lock detection and wait times
  • Clock Sources: Set up clock multiplexing and selection

System PLL magic number macros for handle verification.

#define AM_HAL_MAGIC_SYSPLL   0x504C30
 
#define AM_HAL_SYSPLL_CHK_HANDLE(h)   ((h) && ((am_hal_handle_prefix_t *)(h))->s.bInit && (((am_hal_handle_prefix_t *)(h))->s.magic == AM_HAL_MAGIC_SYSPLL))
 

SYSPLL power state

#define AM_HAL_SYSPLL_POWER_ON   AM_HAL_SYSCTRL_WAKE
 
#define AM_HAL_SYSPLL_POWER_OFF   AM_HAL_SYSCTRL_NORMALSLEEP

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_syspll_bypass_set()

uint32_t am_hal_syspll_bypass_set ( void * pHandle,
bool bBypass )

System PLL refClk bypass function.

Parameters
pHandle- handle for the module instance.
bBypass- boolean setting to bypass refClk.

This function sets bypass setting to bypass PLL reference clock to its output. This function is for debugging purposes only.

Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS: System PLL bypass setting set succesfully.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_HANDLE: Invalid pHandle.

◆ am_hal_syspll_config_generate()

uint32_t am_hal_syspll_config_generate ( am_hal_syspll_config_t * pConfig,
float fRefClkMHz,
float fVCOClkMHz )

Generate system PLL configuration to achieve desired VCO Frequency
This function generates the following configurations for system PLL. configuration not listed needs to be set in separately.

  • eVCOSel
  • eFractionMode
  • ui8RefDiv
  • ui16FBDivInt
  • ui32FBDivFrac
Parameters
pConfig- pointer to the system PLL Config structure.
fRefClkMHz- system PLL reference clock frequency in MHz
fVCOClkMHz- system PLL VCO output frequency desired in MHz
Returns
status - status whether valid configuration is generated:
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS: configuration succesfully generated
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_ARG: invalid arguments received.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_OUT_OF_RANGE: fVCOClkMHz out of range.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_FAIL: No valid configuration found.

◆ am_hal_syspll_config_generate_postdiv()

uint32_t am_hal_syspll_config_generate_postdiv ( am_hal_syspll_config_t * pConfig,
uint32_t ui32VCO_Hz,
uint32_t ui32PostDiv_Hz,
uint32_t ui32PPM )

Generate system PLL POSTDIV1 POSTDIV2 to achieve desired FOUTPOSTDIV Frequency.

Parameters
pConfig- pointer to the system PLL Config structure.
ui32VCO_Hz- based FOUTPLLVCO clock frequency in Hz
ui32PostDiv_Hz- desired FOUTPOSTDIV clock frequency in Hz
ui32PPM- accuracy of the FOUTPOSTDIV
Returns
status - status whether valid configuration is generated:
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS: configuration succesfully generated
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_OUT_OF_RANGE: fVCOClkMHz out of range.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_FAIL: No valid configuration found.

◆ am_hal_syspll_config_generate_with_postdiv()

uint32_t am_hal_syspll_config_generate_with_postdiv ( am_hal_syspll_config_t * pConfig,
uint32_t ui32RefClk_Hz,
uint32_t ui32FoutPostDiv_Hz )

Generate system PLL configuration to achieve desired FOUTPOSTIDV Frequency.

Note
This function is unable to generate eFref of the config. Please fill in the configuration separately
Parameters
pConfig- pointer to the system PLL Config structure.
ui32RefClk_Hz- system PLL reference clock frequency in Hz
ui32FoutPostDiv_Hz- system PLL FOUTPOSTDIV clock frequency desired in Hz
Returns
status - status whether valid configuration is generated:
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS: configuration succesfully generated
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_ARG: invalid arguments received.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_OUT_OF_RANGE: fVCOClkMHz out of range.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_FAIL: No valid configuration found.

◆ am_hal_syspll_configure()

uint32_t am_hal_syspll_configure ( void * pHandle,
am_hal_syspll_config_t * psConfig )

System PLL configuration function.

Parameters
pHandle- pointer to handle for the module instance.
psConfig- pointer to the configuration structure.

This function configures the system PLL for operation.

Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS: System PLL configured succesfully.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_HANDLE: Invalid pHandle.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_OPERATION: Invalid Operation. Make sure that system PLL is not enabled.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_ARG: Invalid system PLL configuration. Make sure that config is valid.

◆ am_hal_syspll_deinitialize()

uint32_t am_hal_syspll_deinitialize ( void * pHandle)

System PLL deinitialization function.

Parameters
pHandle- pointer to handle pointer for the module instance.

This function accepts a handle to an instance and de-initializes the interface.

Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS: System PLL deinitialized succesfully.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_HANDLE: Invalid pHandle.

◆ am_hal_syspll_disable()

uint32_t am_hal_syspll_disable ( void * pHandle)

System PLL disable function.

Parameters
pHandle- pointer to handle for the module instance.

This function disables the system PLL operation.

Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS: System PLL disabled succesfully.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_HANDLE: Invalid pHandle.

◆ am_hal_syspll_enable()

uint32_t am_hal_syspll_enable ( void * pHandle)

System PLL enable function.

Parameters
pHandle- pointer to handle for the module instance.

This function enables the system PLL operation.

Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS: System PLL enabled succesfully.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_HANDLE: Invalid pHandle.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_OPERATION: SIMOBUCK force no in place. Make sure am_bsp_low_power_init() is invoked before enabling system PLL.

◆ am_hal_syspll_initialize()

uint32_t am_hal_syspll_initialize ( uint32_t ui32Module,
void ** ppHandle )

System PLL initialization function.

Parameters
ui32Module- module instance.
handle- pointer to handle pointer for the module instance.

This function accepts a module instance, allocates the interface and then returns a handle to be used by the remaining interface functions.

Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS: System PLL initialized succesfully
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_OUT_OF_RANGE: Invalid ui32Module.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_ARG: Invalid ppHandle.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_OPERATION: Module already initialized.

◆ am_hal_syspll_lock_read()

uint32_t am_hal_syspll_lock_read ( void * pHandle,
bool * pll_ready )

System PLL Get PLL Lock function.

Parameters
pHandle- pointer to handle for the module instance.
pLock- pointer to boolean of PLL lock status.

This function writes true to pLock when PLL clock is ready, and writes false otherwise.

Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS: System PLL lock status read succesfully.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_HANDLE: Invalid pHandle.

◆ am_hal_syspll_lock_wait()

uint32_t am_hal_syspll_lock_wait ( void * pHandle)

System PLL Wait PLL Lock function.

Parameters
pHandle- pointer to handle for the module instance.

This function waits for PLL lock according to System PLL settings

Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS: System PLL locked.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_HANDLE: Invalid pHandle.
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_OPERATION: System PLL not enabled
  • AM_HAL_STATUS_TIMEOUT: System PLL lock wait timed out
